text.section: In addition to any other means of enforcing its order, the court which has ordered a fiduciary to give countersecurity pursuant to the Maryland Rules may compel compliance with its order by attachment and sequestration.

If the fiduciary fails to give countersecurity within the time fixed by the court, and is removed:
The register of wills may bring suit on the bond of the fiduciary to recover taxes and costs; and
If the register does not bring suit on the bond, and a new fiduciary is appointed in his place, the new fiduciary may bring suit on the bond of the removed fiduciary.
